p: A systematic review of psychological and mindâ€“body interventions for endometriosis highlighted several studies that identified a significant reduction in pain when patients were exposed to physical therapy with CBT, yoga, biofeedback, mindfulness and psychotherapy, psychotherapy combined with acupuncture and progressive muscle relaxation ( Evans et al., 2019 ). Not all of these interventions are relevant to self-management at home during isolation, but some are within reach of patients. Moreover, this category of treatment is included and encouraged by The British Pain Society (2013) guidelines on pain management for adults. In a survey of Australian women, 47% of 372 participants used meditation/breathing to self-manage their endometriosis symptoms ( Armour et al., 2019b ).
